com.datamelt.util

Class RowFieldCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.datamelt.util.RowFieldCollection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class RowFieldCollection
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    the RowFieldCollection class represents a container with RowField objects. a RowField object hold the information of the name and value of a field, both as a string. The value of the field that is not a string can be retrieved using the available methods such as e.g. getIntegerFieldValue().
    Author:
    uwe geercken
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • RowFieldCollection

        public RowFieldCollection(java.util.ArrayList<RowField> fields)
        constructor that takes an array of row fields as parameter. as no header fields are specified here, the fields will be added with a default name
        Parameters:
        fields - array of row fields

      • RowFieldCollection

        public RowFieldCollection(java.lang.String[] fieldNames,
                          java.lang.String[] fields)
        constructor that takes an array of field names and an array of values as parameter. RowField objects will be created and added the the list of fields.
        Parameters:
        fieldNames - an array of field names
        fields - an array of field values

      • getFields

        public java.util.ArrayList<RowField> getFields()
        returns the array of fields that belong to the given row object
        Returns:
        array of fields

      • setFields

        public void setFields(java.util.ArrayList<RowField> fields)
        sets the array of fields that belong to the given row object
        Parameters:
        fields - sets the fields to the given array

      • setFields

        public void setFields(java.lang.Object[] fields)
        sets the array of fields that belong to the given row object. if we have field names (a header) then the number of fields in the header will steer the number of fields. if we have no field names (header) then the fields will get the name: DEFAULT_FIELDNAME plus an underbar character plus a running number (e.g. field_3)
        Parameters:
        fields - an array of objects

      • addField

        Add a field to the array of fields.
        Parameters:
        field - a field to be added

        fieldValue - the valu of the field

      • setFieldNames

        public void setFieldNames(java.lang.String[] fieldNames)
        Sets the header row for the fields. If there is a header row available, it should be set before assigning the fields to this collection.
        Parameters:
        fieldNames - names of the fields of the header row

      • getHeader

        public HeaderRow getHeader()

      • setHeader

        public void setHeader(HeaderRow header)
        Sets the header row names for the fields. If there is a header row available, it should be set before assigning the fields to this collection.
        Parameters:
        header - HeaderRow object defining the header fields
